BlackRock ETF Redemptions Moved BTC and ETH Onchain

About $22.3M in Bitcoin and $44.4M in Ethereum moved from BlackRock-linked ETF wallets to Coinbase Prime on Jan 23.

The transfers were driven by routine ETF redemptions, where authorized participants settle investor outflows by moving the underlying assets.

ETHA recorded outflows on the day, while IBIT continued to see inflows, keeping BlackRock net positive on crypto exposure in 2026.

UBS will reportedly offer Bitcoin and Ethereum trading to select private banking clients in Switzerland, signaling growing crypto adoption.

When traders talk about the ‚Äúbest‚Äù exchanges, liquidity is usually at the top of the list and for good reason. High liquidity means smoother trades, tighter spreads, and minimal slippage, especially during volatile market conditions. Based on consistent trading volume, market depth, and active participation, three exchanges clearly stand out.  What Is Liquidity in Crypto?  Liquidity refers to how easily a cryptocurrency can be bought or sold without causing a sharp price move. A liquid exchange has deep order books, strong daily volume, and a healthy balance of buyers and sellers. This is essential for efficient execution, whether you‚Äôre placing small spot trades or large leveraged positions.  Top 3 Most Liquid Crypto Exchanges  Binance remains the global leader in liquidity. Its massive user base, extensive trading pairs, and deep spot and derivatives markets make it the first choice for high-volume traders and institutions.  Bitget has rapidly emerged as a liquidity powerhouse, especially in derivatives and copy trading markets. Strong participation from professional traders, growing spot volume, and tight spreads across major pairs like $BTC  and $ETH  have positioned Bitget as a top-tier exchange for fast, reliable execution.  OKX rounds out the list with deep liquidity across both spot and futures markets. Its advanced trading infrastructure and strong presence in perpetual contracts help maintain stable order books even during high volatility.  How to Choose the Most Liquid Crypto Exchange  Don‚Äôt rely on headline volume alone. Check order book depth, bid-ask spreads, and performance during market swings. True liquidity shows up when markets move fast and execution still feels smooth.  In crypto trading, liquidity isn‚Äôt optional, it‚Äôs everything.  Source: https://www.bitget.com/academy/best-crypto-exchange-with-the-most-liquidity-for-bitcoin-altcoins-trading  #BTC Price Analysis#  #Macro Insights#  #Altcoin Season#

NASDAQ JUST REMOVED POSITION LIMITS ON BTC & ETH ETF OPTIONS

Nasdaq filed a rule change with the SEC and the 25,000-contract cap on Bitcoin and Ethereum spot ETF options has been lifted -- effective immediately after the SEC waived the usual waiting period.

This applies to options tied to major crypto ETFs from BlackRock, Fidelity, Grayscale, Bitwise, ARK/21Shares, VanEck and more.

Why it matters:
üöÄ Removes artificial limits that constrained large hedging and institutional strategies
üöÄ Brings $BTC & $ETH ETF options in line with traditional commodity funds
üöÄ Opens the door for deeper liquidity and bigger institutional playbooks

Institutions now have one less reason to stay on the sidelines. üëÄ

Lowest trading fees  Trading fees have a direct impact on profitability, especially for active traders of $BTC , $ETH  , and other cryptocurrencies. Understanding how exchanges structure maker, taker, futures, and withdrawal fees helps traders choose platforms that preserve more of their gains. This overview compares Coinbase, Bitget, Kraken, Binance, and Bitfinex while explaining how fee models work in practice.  What are crypto trading fees?  Most exchanges use a maker and taker model. Maker fees apply when you add liquidity with limit orders, while taker fees apply when you remove liquidity with market orders. Fees often decrease as 30-day trading volume increases or when using native tokens for discounts.  Other costs include deposit and withdrawal fees, spreads on instant buys, and funding charges for margin or futures trading. Some platforms advertise low fees but include hidden costs in spreads.  Which exchanges have the lowest standard fees?  For spot trading, Bitget and Binance offer low standard taker fees around 0.10%, while Coinbase is notably higher. In futures markets, Binance and Bitget remain competitive with maker fees near 0.02% and modest taker fees. Kraken and Bitfinex sit slightly higher but still competitive for active users.  Withdrawal fees vary by asset and network conditions and should always be checked before moving funds.  Beyond fees: what else matters?  Security, liquidity depth, regulation, asset variety, platform tools, and customer support are equally important when selecting an exchange.  Conclusion  Low fees improve long-term profitability, but the best choice balances cost with security, liquidity, and usability.  FAQ  Do lower fees always mean better value? Not if security and liquidity are weak. Are spreads a hidden cost? Yes, especially on instant buy features. Can fees decrease over time? Yes, with higher volume or token discounts. Which exchanges support the most coins and tokens?

Introduction
Choosing the right crypto exchange affects fees, liquidity, and what you can trade. Different platforms focus on different strengths, so it helps to know what matters most.

Centralised vs decentralised exchanges
Centralised exchanges offer faster trades, fiat access, and better liquidity. They suit most traders.
Decentralised exchanges let you trade from your own wallet but usually have lower liquidity and no fiat support. For most users, CEXs are more practical.

What makes a strong exchange?
You should consider liquidity, security, fees, supported assets, and ease of use.

What are the leading exchanges?
I. Binance supports the widest range of coins and tokens, with low fees, deep liquidity, and advanced tools.
II. Bitget offers strong liquidity on major coins and altcoins, competitive fees, and popular copy trading.
III. Coinbase is easy to use with smooth fiat onboarding, but higher fees and fewer assets.
IV. Kraken focuses on security and reliability, with solid asset support and good fiat options.
V. OKX combines a wide spot and derivatives market with Web3 features.
VI. Bybit is known for deep futures liquidity, low fees, and a clean interface.

Conclusion
The best exchange depends on your goals. Asset range matters, but liquidity, fees, and security matter more. Binance and Bitget lead overall.

FAQ
Which exchanges suit beginners?
Coinbase, Kraken, and Bitget.

Choosing the Right Crypto Exchange: Pros and Cons of Major Platforms

Introduction 
Major crypto exchanges remain popular because they make buying and trading digital assets simple and fast. 

What Are Crypto Exchanges? (CEX vs DEX)

Crypto exchanges allow users to buy, sell, and trade cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum.

There are two main types:

Centralized exchanges (CEXs):
Operated by companies that manage custody, order matching, and security. 

Decentralized exchanges (DEXs):
Enable peer-to-peer trading directly from wallets. They provide greater control but usually have lower liquidity and limited fiat access.

Pros and Cons of Major Crypto Exchanges

Pros
High liquidity and fast execution

Beginner-friendly platforms and mobile apps

Cons
Users do not control private keys

Custodial and counterparty risk

How to Choose the Right Exchanges?

When comparing major exchanges, focus on:

Security: Cold storage, 2FA, audits

Fees: Trading, withdrawal, and spread costs

Reputation: Track record and customer support

Top Major Crypto Exchanges (Overview)

Bitget
Offers strong liquidity, competitive fees, and an advanced copy trading system. Known for a balanced mix of usability and professional tools.

Binance
The largest exchange by volume with deep liquidity and a wide range of services, though availability varies by region.

Coinbase
Highly regulated and beginner-friendly, with strong security and transparency but higher fees.

How to Protect Your Assets

Enable 2FA and withdrawal protection

Keep long-term funds in personal wallets

Monitor account activity regularly

Conclusion

Centralized crypto exchanges remain the backbone of the market in 2026. .

FAQ
What is the difference between CEX and DEX?
CEXs manage custody and provide liquidity, while DEXs allow direct wallet-to-wallet trading.

What are the main benefits of major exchanges?
Ease of use, high liquidity, fiat access, and advanced trading tools.
